paragraph.content: An extension of credit made pursuant to a program authorized by sections 101 and 109 of the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 (12 U.S.C. 5211; 5219);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c
paragraph.title: Repayment ability
paragraph.content: Repayment ability —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-1
paragraph.title: General requirement.
paragraph.content: General requirement. A creditor shall not make a loan that is a covered transaction unless the creditor makes a reasonable and good faith determination at or before consummation that the consumer will have a reasonable ability to repay the loan according to its terms.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2
paragraph.title: Basis for determination.
paragraph.content: Basis for determination. Except as provided otherwise in paragraphs (d), (e), and (f) of this section, in making the repayment ability determination required under paragraph (c)(1) of this section, a creditor must consider the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-i
paragraph.content: The consumer's current or reasonably expected income or assets, other than the value of the dwelling, including any real property attached to the dwelling, that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: If the creditor relies on income from the consumer's employment in determining repayment ability, the consumer's current employment status;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: The consumer's monthly payment on the covered transaction, calculated in accordance with paragraph (c)(5) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: The consumer's monthly payment on any simultaneous loan that the creditor knows or has reason to know will be made, calculated in accordance with paragraph (c)(6) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-v
paragraph.content: The consumer's monthly payment for mortgage-related obligations;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: The consumer's current debt obligations, alimony, and child support;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income in accordance with paragraph (c)(7) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-2-viii
paragraph.content: The consumer's credit history.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3
paragraph.title: Verification using third-party records.
paragraph.content: Verification using third-party records. A creditor must verify the information that the creditor relies on in determining a consumer's repayment ability under § 1026.43(c)(2) using reasonably reliable third-party records, except that:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph (c)(2)(i) of this section, a creditor must verify a consumer's income or assets that the creditor relies on in accordance with § 1026.43(c)(4);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph (c)(2)(ii) of this section, a creditor may verify a consumer's employment status orally if the creditor prepares a record of the information obtained orally; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-3-iii
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph (c)(2)(vi) of this section, if a creditor relies on a consumer's credit report to verify a consumer's current debt obligations and a consumer's application states a current debt obligation not shown in the consumer's credit report, the creditor need not independently verify such an obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4
paragraph.title: Verification of income or assets.
paragraph.content: Verification of income or assets. A creditor must verify the amounts of income or assets that the creditor relies on under § 1026.43(c)(2)(i) to determine a consumer's ability to repay a covered transaction using third-party records that provide reasonably reliable evidence of the consumer's income or assets. A creditor may verify the consumer's income using a tax-return transcript issued by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Examples of other records the creditor may use to verify the consumer's income or assets include:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-i
paragraph.content: Copies of tax returns the consumer filed with the IRS or a State taxing authority;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-ii
paragraph.content: IRS Form W-2s or similar IRS forms used for reporting wages or tax withholding;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iii
paragraph.content: Payroll statements, including military Leave and Earnings Statements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-iv
paragraph.content: Financial institution records;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-v
paragraph.content: Records from the consumer's employer or a third party that obtained information from the employer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vi
paragraph.content: Records from a Federal, State, or local government agency stating the consumer's income from benefits or entitlements;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-vii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the consumer's use of check cashing services; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-4-viii
paragraph.content: Receipts from the consumer's use of a funds transfer service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculation
paragraph.content: Payment calculation —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. Except as provided in paragraph (c)(5)(ii) of this section, a creditor must make the consideration required under paragraph (c)(2)(iii) of this section using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The fully indexed rate or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-i-B
paragraph.content: Monthly, fully amortizing payments that are substantially equal.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii
paragraph.title: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans.
paragraph.content: Special rules for loans with a balloon payment, interest-only loans, and negative amortization loans. A creditor must make the consideration required under paragraph (c)(2)(iii) of this section for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan with a balloon payment, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(5)(i), using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: The maximum payment scheduled during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due for a loan that is not a higher-priced covered transaction; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: The maximum payment in the payment schedule, including any balloon payment, for a higher-priced covered transaction;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(iv), using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-1
paragraph.content: The fully indexed rate or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-B-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the loan amount over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is recast.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(v), using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-1
paragraph.content: The fully indexed rate or any introductory interest rate, whichever is greater; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-5-ii-C-2
paragraph.content: Substantially equal, monthly payments of principal and interest that will repay the maximum loan amount over the term of the loan remaining as of the date the loan is recast.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6
paragraph.title: Payment calculation for simultaneous loans.
paragraph.content: Payment calculation for simultaneous loans. For purposes of making the evaluation required under paragraph (c)(2)(iv) of this section, a creditor must consider, taking into account any mortgage-related obligations, a consumer's payment on a simultaneous loan that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-i
paragraph.content: A covered transaction, by following paragraph (c)(5)of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-6-ii
paragraph.content: A home equity line of credit subject to § 1026.40, by using the periodic payment required under the terms of the plan and the amount of credit to be drawn at or before consummation of the covered transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph (c)(7), the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-A
paragraph.title: Total monthly debt obligations.
paragraph.content: Total monthly debt obligations. The term total monthly debt obligations means the sum of: the payment on the covered transaction, as required to be calculated by paragraphs (c)(2)(iii) and (c)(5) of this section; simultaneous loans, as required by paragraphs (c)(2)(iv) and (c)(6) of this section; mortgage-related obligations, as required by paragraph (c)(2)(v) of this section; and current debt obligations, alimony, and child support, as required by paragraph (c)(2)(vi) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-i-B
paragraph.title: Total monthly income.
paragraph.content: Total monthly income. The term total monthly income means the sum of the consumer's current or reasonably expected income, including any income from assets, as required by paragraphs (c)(2)(i) and (c)(4) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii
paragraph.title: Calculations—
paragraph.content: Calculations—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-A
paragraph.title: Monthly debt-to-income ratio.
paragraph.content: Monthly debt-to-income ratio. If a creditor considers the consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio under paragraph (c)(2)(vii) of this section, the creditor must consider the ratio of the consumer's total monthly debt obligations to the consumer's total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-c-7-ii-B
paragraph.title: Monthly residual income.
paragraph.content: Monthly residual income. If a creditor considers the consumer's monthly residual income under paragraph (c)(2)(vii) of this section, the creditor must consider the consumer's remaining income after subtracting the consumer's total monthly debt obligations from the consumer's total monthly income.

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i
paragraph.content: An escrow account need not be established for:

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-A
paragraph.content: A transaction secured by shares in a cooperative;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-B
paragraph.content: A transaction to finance the initial construction of a dwelling;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-C
paragraph.content: A temporary or “bridge” loan with a loan term of twelve months or less, such as a loan to purchase a new dwelling where the consumer plans to sell a current dwelling within twelve months; or

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-i-D
paragraph.content: A reverse mortgage transaction subject to § 1026.33(c).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgages—
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgages—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1
paragraph.title: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance—
paragraph.content: Safe harbor and presumption of compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-i
paragraph.title: Safe harbor for transactions that are not higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Safe harbor for loans that are not higher-priced covered transactions. A creditor or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraphs (e)(2), (e)(4), (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section, that is not a higher-priced covered transaction, as defined in paragraph (b)(4) of this section, complies with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph (c) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii
paragraph.title: Presumption of compliance for higher-priced covered transactions.
paragraph.content: Presumption of compliance for higher-priced covered transactions.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: A creditor or assignee of a qualified mortgage, as defined in paragraph (e)(2), (e)(4), (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section, that is a higher-priced covered transaction, as defined in paragraph (b)(4) of this section, is presumed to comply with the repayment ability requirements of paragraph (c) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: To rebut the presumption of compliance described in paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) of this section, it must be proven that, despite meeting the prerequisites of paragraph (e)(2), (e)(4), (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section, the creditor did not make a reasonable and good faith determination of the consumer's repayment ability at the time of consummation, by showing that the consumer's income, debt obligations, alimony, child support, and the consumer's monthly payment (including mortgage-related obligations) on the covered transaction and on any simultaneous loans of which the creditor was aware at consummation would leave the consumer with insufficient residual income or assets other than the value of the dwelling (including any real property attached to the dwelling) that secures the loan with which to meet living expenses, including any recurring and material non-debt obligations of which the creditor was aware at the time of consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—general.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—general. Except as provided in paragraph (e)(4), (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section, a qualified mortgage is a covered transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that are substantially equal, except for the effect that any interest rate change after consummation has on the payment in the case of an adjustable-rate or step-rate mortgage, that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-A
paragraph.content: Result in an increase of the principal balance;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-B
paragraph.content: Allow the consumer to defer repayment of principal, except as provided in paragraph (f) of this section; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(5)(i), except as provided in paragraph (f) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-ii
paragraph.content: For which the loan term does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iii
paragraph.content: For which the total points and fees payable in connection with the loan do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph (e)(3) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv
paragraph.content: For which the creditor underwrites the loan, taking into account the monthly payment for mortgage-related obligations, using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after the date on which the first regular periodic payment will be due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: Periodic payments of principal and interest that will repay either:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-1
paragraph.content: The outstanding principal balance over the remaining term of the loan as of the date the interest rate adjusts to the maximum interest rate set forth in paragraph (e)(2)(iv)(A) of this section, assuming the consumer will have made all required payments as due prior to that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-iv-B-2
paragraph.content: The loan amount over the loan term;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v
paragraph.content: For which the creditor considers and verifies at or before consummation the following:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The consumer's current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the value of the dwelling (including any real property attached to the dwelling) that secures the loan, in accordance with appendix Q and paragraphs (c)(2)(i) and (c)(4) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-v-B
paragraph.content: The consumer's current debt obligations, alimony, and child support in accordance with appendix Q and paragraphs (c)(2)(vi) and (c)(3) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi
paragraph.content: For which the ratio of the consumer's total monthly debt to total monthly income at the time of consummation does not exceed 43 percent. For purposes of this paragraph (e)(2)(vi), the ratio of the consumer's total monthly debt to total monthly income is determined:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: Except as provided in paragraph (e)(2)(vi)(B) of this section, in accordance with the standards in appendix Q;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Using the consumer's monthly payment on:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-1
paragraph.content: The covered transaction, including the monthly payment for mortgage-related obligations, in accordance with paragraph (e)(2)(iv) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-2-vi-B-2
paragraph.content: Any simultaneous loan that the creditor knows or has reason to know will be made, in accordance with paragraphs (c)(2)(iv) and (c)(6) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3
paragraph.title: Limits on points and fees for qualified mortgages.
paragraph.content: Limits on points and fees for qualified mortgages.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i
paragraph.content: A covered transaction is not a qualified mortgage unless the transaction's total points and fees, as defined in § 1026.32(b)(1), do not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $100,000 (indexed for inflation): 3 percent of the total loan amount;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $60,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $100,000 (indexed for inflation): $3,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $20,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $60,000 (indexed for inflation): 5 percent of the total loan amount;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-D
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $12,500 (indexed for inflation) but less than $20,000 (indexed for inflation): $1,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-E
paragraph.content: For a loan amount less than $12,500 (indexed for inflation): 8 percent of the total loan amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-ii
paragraph.content: The dollar amounts, including the loan amounts, in paragraph (e)(3)(i) of this section shall be adjusted annually on January 1 by the annual percentage change in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) that was reported on the preceding June 1. See the official commentary to this paragraph (e)(3)(ii) for the current dollar amounts.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—special rules —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i
paragraph.title: General.
paragraph.content: General. Notwithstanding paragraph (e)(2) of this section, a qualified mortgage is a covered transaction that satisfies:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-A
paragraph.content: The requirements of paragraphs (e)(2)(i) through (iii) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-i-B
paragraph.content: One or more of the criteria in paragraph (e)(4)(ii) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii
paragraph.title: Eligible loans.
paragraph.content: Eligible loans. A qualified mortgage under this paragraph (e)(4) must be one of the following at consummation:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation operating under the conservatorship or receivership of the Federal Housing Finance Agency pursuant to section 1367(a) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992 (12 U.S.C. 4617(a)); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: To be purchased or guaranteed by any limited-life regulatory entity succeeding the charter of either the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation pursuant to section 1367(i) of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992 (12 U.S.C. 4617(i));

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development under the National Housing Act (12 U.S.C. 1707 et seq.);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-C
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-D
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be guaranteed by the U.S. Department of Agriculture pursuant to 42 U.S.C. 1472(h); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-ii-E
paragraph.content: A loan that is eligible to be insured by the Rural Housing Service.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Sunset of special rules.
paragraph.content: Sunset of special rules.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-A
paragraph.content: Each respective special rule described in paragraph (e)(4)(ii)(B), (C), (D), or (E) of this section shall expire on the effective date of a rule issued by each respective agency pursuant to its authority under TILA section 129C(b)(3)(ii) to define a qualified mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-4-iii-B
paragraph.content: Unless otherwise expired under paragraph (e)(4)(iii)(A) of this section, the special rules in this paragraph (e)(4) are available only for covered transactions consummated on or before January 10, 2021.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—small creditor portfolio loans.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—small creditor portfolio loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph (e)(2) of this section, a qualified mortgage is a covered transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-A
paragraph.content: That satisfies the requirements of paragraph (e)(2) of this section other than the requirements of paragraph (e)(2)(vi) and without regard to the standards in appendix Q to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-B
paragraph.content: For which the creditor considers at or before consummation the consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph (c)(7) of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the covered transaction for purposes of determining the consumer's total monthly debt obligations in paragraph (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph (e)(2)(iv) of this section instead of paragraph (c)(5) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-C
paragraph.content: That is not subject, at consummation, to a commitment to be acquired by another person, other than a person that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (e)(5)(i)(D) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-i-D
paragraph.content: For which the creditor satisfies the requirements stated in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(B) and (C).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii
paragraph.content: A qualified mortgage extended pursuant to paragraph (e)(5)(i) of this section immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph (e)(5)(i) if legal title to the qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-A
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person three years or more after consummation of the qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-B
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a creditor that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (e)(5)(i)(D) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-C
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under 12 U.S.C. 1831o, actions or instructions of any person acting as conservator, receiver, or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a State or Federal government agency with jurisdiction to examine the creditor pursuant to State or Federal law, or an agreement between the creditor and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-5-ii-D
paragraph.content: The qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the creditor with another person or acquisition of the creditor by another person or of another person by the creditor.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6
paragraph.title: Qualified mortgage defined—temporary balloon-payment qualified mortgage rules.
paragraph.content: Qualified mortgage defined—temporary balloon-payment qualified mortgage rules.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i
paragraph.content: Notwithstanding paragraph (e)(2) of this section, a qualified mortgage is a covered transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i-A
paragraph.content: That satisfies the requirements of paragraph (f) of this section other than the requirements of paragraph (f)(1)(vi); and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-i-B
paragraph.content: For which the creditor satisfies the requirements stated in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(B) and (C).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-6-ii
paragraph.content: The provisions of this paragraph (e)(6) apply only to covered transactions consummated on or before January 10, 2016.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d
paragraph.title: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages
paragraph.content: Refinancing of non-standard mortgages —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1
paragraph.title: Definitions.
paragraph.content: Definitions. For purposes of this paragraph (d), the following definitions apply:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a covered transaction that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(i), with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(iv); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(v).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. The term standard mortgage means a covered transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: That provides for regular periodic payments that do not:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-1
paragraph.content: Cause the principal balance to increase;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-2
paragraph.content: Allow the consumer to defer repayment of principal; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-A-3
paragraph.content: Result in a balloon payment, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(5)(i);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: For which the total points and fees payable in connection with the transaction do not exceed the amounts specified in paragraph (e)(3) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: For which the term does not exceed 40 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-D
paragraph.content: For which the interest rate is fixed for at least the first five years after consummation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E
paragraph.content: For which the proceeds from the loan are used solely for the following purposes:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-1
paragraph.content: To pay off the outstanding principal balance on the non-standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-ii-E-2
paragraph.content: To pay closing or settlement charges required to be disclosed under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, 12 U.S.C. 2601 et seq.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-iii
paragraph.title: Refinancing.
paragraph.content: Refinancing. The term refinancing has the same meaning as in § 1026.20(a).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2
paragraph.title: Scope.
paragraph.content: Scope. The provisions of this paragraph (d) apply to the refinancing of a non-standard mortgage into a standard mortgage when the following conditions are met:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The creditor for the standard mortgage is the current holder of the existing non-standard mortgage or the servicer acting on behalf of the current holder;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The monthly payment for the standard mortgage is materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, as calculated under paragraph (d)(5) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: The creditor receives the consumer's written application for the standard mortgage no later than two months after the non-standard mortgage has recast.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: The consumer has made no more than one payment more than 30 days late on the non-standard mortgage during the 12 months immediately preceding the creditor's receipt of the consumer's written application for the standard mortgage.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-v
paragraph.content: The consumer has made no payments more than 30 days late during the six months immediately preceding the creditor's receipt of the consumer's written application for the standard mortgage; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: If the non-standard mortgage was consummated on or after January 10, 2014, the non-standard mortgage was made in accordance with paragraph (c) or (e) of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3
paragraph.title: Exemption from repayment ability requirements.
paragraph.content: Exemption from repayment ability requirements. A creditor is not required to comply with the requirements of paragraph (c) of this section if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The conditions in paragraph (d)(2) of this section are met; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The creditor has considered whether the standard mortgage likely will prevent a default by the consumer on the non-standard mortgage once the loan is recast.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-4
paragraph.title: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms.
paragraph.content: Offer of rate discounts and other favorable terms. A creditor making a covered transaction under this paragraph (d) may offer to the consumer rate discounts and terms that are the same as, or better than, the rate discounts and terms that the creditor offers to new consumers, consistent with the creditor's documented underwriting practices and to the extent not prohibited by applicable State or Federal law.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5
paragraph.title: Payment calculations.
paragraph.content: Payment calculations. For purposes of determining whether the consumer's monthly payment for a standard mortgage will be materially lower than the monthly payment for the non-standard mortgage, the following provisions shall be used:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph (d)(2)(ii) of this section, the creditor must calculate the monthly payment for a non-standard mortgage based on substantially equal, monthly, fully amortizing payments of principal and interest using:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-A
paragraph.content: The fully indexed rate as of a reasonable period of time before or after the date on which the creditor receives the consumer's written application for the standard mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-B
paragraph.content: The term of the loan remaining as of the date on which the recast occurs, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the recast date and the payment due on the recast date is made and credited as of that date; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C
paragraph.content: A remaining loan amount that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-1
paragraph.content: For an adjustable-rate mortgage under paragraph (d)(1)(i)(A) of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the recast, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the recast date and the payment due on the recast date is made and credited as of that date;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-2
paragraph.content: For an interest-only loan under paragraph (d)(1)(i)(B) of this section, the outstanding principal balance as of the date of the recast, assuming all scheduled payments have been made up to the recast date and the payment due on the recast date is made and credited as of that date; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-i-C-3
paragraph.content: For a negative amortization loan under paragraph (d)(1)(i)(C) of this section, the maximum loan amount, determined after adjusting for the outstanding principal balance.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-5-ii
paragraph.title: Standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Standard mortgage. For purposes of the comparison conducted pursuant to paragraph (d)(2)(ii) of this section, the monthly payment for a standard mortgage must be based on substantially equal, monthly, fully amortizing payments based on the maximum interest rate that may apply during the first five years after consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g
paragraph.title: Prepayment penalties
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalties —

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1
paragraph.title: When permitted.
paragraph.content: When permitted. A covered transaction must not include a prepayment penalty unless:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-i
paragraph.content: The prepayment penalty is otherwise permitted by law; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii
paragraph.content: The transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after consummation;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: Is a qualified mortgage under paragraph (e)(2), (e)(4), (e)(5), (e)(6), or (f) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-1-ii-C
paragraph.content: Is not a higher-priced mortgage loan, as defined in § 1026.35(a).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2
paragraph.title: Limits on prepayment penalties.
paragraph.content: Limits on prepayment penalties. A prepayment penalty:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-i
paragraph.content: Must not apply after the three-year period following consummation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii
paragraph.content: Must not exceed the following percentages of the amount of the outstanding loan balance prepaid:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: 2 percent, if incurred during the first two years following consummation; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: 1 percent, if incurred during the third year following consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3
paragraph.title: Alternative offer required.
paragraph.content: Alternative offer required. A creditor must not offer a consumer a covered transaction with a prepayment penalty unless the creditor also offers the consumer an alternative covered transaction without a prepayment penalty and the alternative covered transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i
paragraph.content: Has an annual percentage rate that cannot increase after consummation and has the same type of interest rate as the covered transaction with a prepayment penalty; for purposes of this paragraph (g), the term “type of interest rate” refers to whether a transaction:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-A
paragraph.content: Is a fixed-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(iii); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-i-B
paragraph.content: Is a step-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(ii);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-ii
paragraph.content: Has the same loan term as the loan term for the covered transaction with a prepayment penalty;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iii
paragraph.content: Satisfies the periodic payment conditions under paragraph (e)(2)(i) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-iv
paragraph.content: Satisfies the points and fees conditions under paragraph (e)(2)(iii) of this section, based on the information known to the creditor at the time the transaction is offered; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-3-v
paragraph.content: Is a transaction for which the creditor has a good faith belief that the consumer likely qualifies, based on the information known to the creditor at the time the creditor offers the covered transaction without a prepayment penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4
paragraph.title: Offer through a mortgage broker.
paragraph.content: Offer through a mortgage broker. If the creditor offers a covered transaction with a prepayment penalty to the consumer through a mortgage broker, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(2), the creditor must:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-i
paragraph.content: Present the mortgage broker an alternative covered transaction without a prepayment penalty that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (g)(3) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii
paragraph.content: Establish by agreement that the mortgage broker must present the consumer an alternative covered transaction without a prepayment penalty that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (g)(3) of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-A
paragraph.content: The creditor; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-4-ii-B
paragraph.content: Another creditor, if the transaction offered by the other creditor has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of discount points and origination points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5
paragraph.title: Creditor that is a loan originator.
paragraph.content: Creditor that is a loan originator. If the creditor is a loan originator, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1), and the creditor presents the consumer a covered transaction offered by a person to which the creditor would assign the covered transaction after consummation, the creditor must present the consumer an alternative covered transaction without a prepayment penalty that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (g)(3) of this section, offered by:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-i
paragraph.content: The assignee; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-5-ii
paragraph.content: Another person, if the transaction offered by the other person has a lower interest rate or a lower total dollar amount of origination discount points and points or fees.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6
paragraph.title: Applicability.
paragraph.content: Applicability. This paragraph (g) applies only if a covered transaction is consummated with a prepayment penalty and is not violated if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-i
paragraph.content: A covered transaction is consummated without a prepayment penalty; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-g-6-ii
paragraph.content: The creditor and consumer do not consummate a covered transaction.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f
paragraph.title: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain creditors—
paragraph.content: Balloon-payment qualified mortgages made by certain creditors—

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph (e)(2) of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs (e)(2)(i)(A), (e)(2)(ii), (e)(2)(iii), and (e)(2)(v) of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix Q;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The creditor determines at or before consummation that the consumer can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph (f)(1)(iv) of this section, together with the consumer's monthly payments for all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment, from the consumer's current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the dwelling that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The creditor considers at or before consummation the consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph (c)(7) of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the covered transaction for purposes of determining the consumer's total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph (f)(iv)(A) of this section, together with the consumer's monthly payments for all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A loan term of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at consummation, to a commitment to be acquired by another person, other than a person that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (f)(1)(vi) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The creditor satisfies the requirements stated in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A), (B), and (C).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2
paragraph.title: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage.
paragraph.content: Post-consummation transfer of balloon-payment qualified mortgage. A balloon-payment qualified mortgage, extended pursuant to paragraph (f)(1), immediately loses its status as a qualified mortgage under paragraph (f)(1) if legal title to the balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person except when:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-i
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person three years or more after consummation of the balloon-payment qualified mortgage;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-ii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to a creditor that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (f)(1)(vi) of this section;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iii
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred to another person pursuant to a capital restoration plan or other action under 12 U.S.C. 1831o, actions or instructions of any person acting as conservator, receiver or bankruptcy trustee, an order of a State or Federal governmental agency with jurisdiction to examine the creditor pursuant to State or Federal law, or an agreement between the creditor and such an agency; or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-2-iv
paragraph.content: The balloon-payment qualified mortgage is sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred pursuant to a merger of the creditor with another person or acquisition of the creditor by another person or of another person by the creditor.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-h
paragraph.title: Evasion; open-end credit.
paragraph.content: Evasion; open-end credit. In connection with credit secured by a consumer's dwelling that does not meet the definition of open-end credit in § 1026.2(a)(20), a creditor shall not structure the loan as an open-end plan to evade the requirements of this section.

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-a-Interp-5-i
interpParagraph.content: General. For purposes of § 1026.36, compensation is defined in § 1026.36(a)(3) as salaries, commissions, and any financial or similar incentive. For example, the term “compensation” includes:

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-a-Interp-5-i-A
interpParagraph.content: An annual or other periodic bonus; or

interpParagraph.label: 1026-36-a-Interp-5-i-B
interpParagraph.content: Awards of merchandise, services, trips, or similar prizes.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3
paragraph.title: Exemption from repayment ability requirements.
paragraph.content: Exemption from repayment ability requirements. A creditor is not required to comply with the requirements of paragraph (c) of this section if:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-i
paragraph.content: The conditions in paragraph (d)(2) of this section are met; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The creditor has considered whether the standard mortgage likely will prevent a default by the consumer on the non-standard mortgage once the loan is recast.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i
paragraph.content: For purposes of this section, the term “loan originator” means a person who, in expectation of direct or indirect compensation or other monetary gain or for direct or indirect compensation or other monetary gain, performs any of the following activities: takes an application, offers, arranges, assists a consumer in obtaining or applying to obtain, negotiates, or otherwise obtains or makes an extension of consumer credit for another person; or through advertising or other means of communication represents to the public that such person can or will perform any of these activities. The term “loan originator” includes an employee, agent, or contractor of the creditor or loan originator organization if the employee, agent, or contractor meets this definition. The term “loan originator” includes a creditor that engages in loan origination activities if the creditor does not finance the transaction at consummation out of the creditor's own resources, including by drawing on a bona fide warehouse line of credit or out of deposits held by the creditor. All creditors that engage in any of the foregoing loan origination activities are loan originators for purposes of paragraphs (f) and (g) of this section. The term does not include:

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-A
paragraph.content: A person who does not take a consumer credit application or offer or negotiate credit terms available from a creditor, but who performs purely administrative or clerical tasks on behalf of a person who does engage in such activities.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An employee of a manufactured home retailer who does not take a consumer credit application, offer or negotiate credit terms available from a creditor, or advise a consumer on credit terms (including rates, fees, and other costs) available from a creditor.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A person that performs only real estate brokerage activities and is licensed or registered in accordance with applicable State law, unless such person is compensated by a creditor or loan originator or by any agent of such creditor or loan originator for a particular consumer credit transaction subject to this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-D
paragraph.content: A seller financer that meets the criteria in paragraph (a)(4) or (a)(5) of this section, as applicable.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-i-E
paragraph.content: A servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate terms for purposes of renegotiating, modifying, replacing, or subordinating principal of existing mortgages where consumers are behind in their payments, in default, or have a reasonable likelihood of defaulting or falling behind. This exception does not apply, however, to a servicer or servicer's employees, agents, and contractors who offer or negotiate a transaction that constitutes a refinancing under § 1026.20(a) or obligates a different consumer on the existing debt.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A loan term of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-1
paragraph.content: Covered transaction means a consumer credit transaction that is secured by a dwelling, as defined in § 1026.2(a)(19), including any real property attached to a dwelling, other than a transaction exempt from coverage under paragraph (a) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph (d)(2)(i) of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph (d)(3)(i) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-e-4-iii
paragraph.title: Small servicer determination.
paragraph.content: Small servicer determination. In determining whether a small servicer services 5,000 or fewer mortgage loans, a servicer is evaluated based on the number of mortgage loans serviced by the servicer and any affiliates as of January 1 for the remainder of the calendar year. A servicer that crosses the threshold will have six months after crossing the threshold or until the next January 1, whichever is later, to comply with any requirements for which a servicer is no longer exempt as a small servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-36-a-1-ii
paragraph.content: An “individual loan originator” is a natural person who meets the definition of “loan originator” in paragraph (a)(1)(i) of this section.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a
paragraph.title: Refinancings.
paragraph.content: Refinancings. A refinancing occurs when an existing obligation that was subject to this subpart is satisfied and replaced by a new obligation undertaken by the same consumer. A refinancing is a new transaction requiring new disclosures to the consumer. The new finance charge shall include any unearned portion of the old finance charge that is not credited to the existing obligation. The following shall not be treated as a refinancing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-1
paragraph.content: A renewal of a single payment obligation with no change in the original terms.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-2
paragraph.content: A reduction in the annual percentage rate with a corresponding change in the payment schedule.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-3
paragraph.content: An agreement involving a court proceeding.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-4
paragraph.content: A change in the payment schedule or a change in collateral requirements as a result of the consumer's default or delinquency, unless the rate is increased, or the new amount financed exceeds the unpaid balance plus earned finance charge and premiums for continuation of insurance of the types described in § 1026.4(d).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-a-5
paragraph.content: The renewal of optional insurance purchased by the consumer and added to an existing transaction, if disclosures relating to the initial purchase were provided as required by this subpart.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b
paragraph.title: Assumptions.
paragraph.content: Assumptions. An assumption occurs when a creditor expressly agrees in writing with a subsequent consumer to accept that consumer as a primary obligor on an existing residential mortgage transaction. Before the assumption occurs, the creditor shall make new disclosures to the subsequent consumer, based on the remaining obligation. If the finance charge originally imposed on the existing obligation was an add-on or discount finance charge, the creditor need only disclose:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-1
paragraph.content: The unpaid balance of the obligation assumed.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-2
paragraph.content: The total charges imposed by the creditor in connection with the assumption.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-3
paragraph.content: The information required to be disclosed under § 1026.18(k), (l), (m), and (n).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-4
paragraph.content: The annual percentage rate originally imposed on the obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-b-5
paragraph.content: The payment schedule under § 1026.18(g) and the total of payments under § 1026.18(h) based on the remaining obligation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c
paragraph.title: Variable-rate adjustments.
paragraph.content: Rate adjustments with a corresponding change in payment. The ccreditor, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide consumers with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (c), in connection with the adjustment of interest rates pursuant to the loan contract that results in a corresponding adjustment to the payment. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (c), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to creditors. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) also shall be provided for an interest rate adjustment resulting from the conversion of an adjustable-rate mortgage to a fixed-rate transaction, if that interest rate adjustment results in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph (c), an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end consumer credit transaction secured by the consumer's principal dwelling in which the annual percentage rate may increase after consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph (c) do not apply to:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-A
paragraph.content: ARMs with terms of one year or less;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-1-ii-B
paragraph.content: The first interest rate adjustment to an ARM if the first payment at the adjusted level is due within 210 days after consummation and the new interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was not an estimate; or

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2
paragraph.content: Timing and content. Except as otherwise provided in paragraph (c)(2) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided to consumers at least 60, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. The disclosures shall be provided to consumers at least 25, but no more than 120, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for ARMs with uniformly scheduled interest rate adjustments occurring every 60 days or more frequently and for ARMs originated prior to January 10, 2015 in which the loan contract requires the adjusted interest rate and payment to be calculated based on the index figure available as of a date that is less than 45 days prior to the adjustment date. The disclosures shall be provided to consumers as soon as practicable, but not less than 25 days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due, for the first adjustment to an ARM if it occurs within 60 days of consummation and the new interest rate disclosed at consummation pursuant to § 1026.20(d) was an estimate. The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the consumer's adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and the interest rate and mortgage payment will change;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-i-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index, and any application of previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-iv
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the creditor, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin or the application of any previously foregone interest rate increases from past interest rate adjustments;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-v-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vi
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-2-vii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § 1026.32(b)(6)(i), may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal dwelling; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the consumer may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-i
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by this paragraph (c) shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms H-4(D)(1) and (2) in appendix H to this part; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-c-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph (c)(2)(ii) of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph (c)(3)(i) of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms H-4(D)(1) and (2) in appendix H to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d
paragraph.content: Initial rate adjustment. The creditor, assignee, or servicer of an adjustable-rate mortgage shall provide consumers with disclosures, as described in this paragraph (d), in connection with the initial interest rate adjustment pursuant to the loan contract. To the extent that other provisions of this subpart C govern the disclosures required by this paragraph (d), those provisions apply to assignees and servicers as well as to creditors. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided as a separate document from other documents provided by the creditor, assignee, or servicer. The disclosures shall be provided to consumers at least 210, but no more than 240, days before the first payment at the adjusted level is due. If the first payment at the adjusted level is due within the first 210 days after consummation, the disclosures shall be provided at consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1
paragraph.title: Coverage.
paragraph.content: Coverage.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-i
paragraph.title: In general.
paragraph.content: In general. For purposes of this paragraph (d), an adjustable-rate mortgage or “ARM” is a closed-end consumer credit transaction secured by the consumer's principal dwelling in which the annual percentage rate may increase after consummation.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-1-ii
paragraph.title: Exemptions.
paragraph.content: Exemptions. The requirements of this paragraph (d) do not apply to ARMs with terms of one year or less.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2
paragraph.title: Content.
paragraph.content: Content. If the new interest rate (or the new payment calculated from the new interest rate) is not known as of the date of the disclosure, an estimate shall be disclosed and labeled as such. This estimate shall be based on the calculation of the index reported in the source of information described in paragraph (d)(2)(iv)(A) of this section within fifteen business days prior to the date of the disclosure. The disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall include:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The date of the disclosure.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: A statement providing:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-A
paragraph.content: An explanation that under the terms of the consumer's adjustable-rate mortgage, the specific time period in which the current interest rate has been in effect is ending and that any change in the interest rate may result in a change in the mortgage payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-B
paragraph.content: The effective date of the interest rate adjustment and when additional future interest rate adjustments are scheduled to occur; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ii-C
paragraph.content: Any other changes to loan terms, features, or options taking effect on the same date as the interest rate adjustment, such as the expiration of interest-only or payment-option features.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: A table containing the following information:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-A
paragraph.content: The current and new interest rates;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-B
paragraph.content: The current and new payments and the date the first new payment is due; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iii-C
paragraph.content: For interest-only or negatively-amortizing payments, the amount of the current and new payment allocated to principal, interest, and taxes and insurance in escrow, as applicable. The current payment allocation disclosed shall be the payment allocation for the last payment prior to the date of the disclosure. The new payment allocation disclosed shall be the expected payment allocation for the first payment for which the new interest rate will apply.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the interest rate is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-A
paragraph.content: The specific index or formula used in making interest rate adjustments and a source of information about the index or formula; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: The type and amount of any adjustment to the index, including any margin and an explanation that the margin is the addition of a certain number of percentage points to the index.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-v
paragraph.content: Any limits on the interest rate or payment increases at each interest rate adjustment and over the life of the loan, as applicable, including the extent to which such limits result in the creditor, assignee, or servicer foregoing any increase in the interest rate and the earliest date that such foregone interest rate increases may apply to future interest rate adjustments, subject to those limits.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi
paragraph.content: An explanation of how the new payment is determined, including:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-A
paragraph.content: The index or formula used;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-B
paragraph.content: Any adjustment to the index or formula, such as the addition of a margin;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-C
paragraph.content: The loan balance expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-D
paragraph.content: The length of the remaining loan term expected on the date of the interest rate adjustment and any change in the term of the loan caused by the adjustment; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vi-E
paragraph.content: If the new interest rate or new payment provided is an estimate, a statement that another disclosure containing the actual new interest rate and new payment will be provided to the consumer between two and four months before the first payment at the adjusted level is due for interest rate adjustments that result in a corresponding payment change.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-vii
paragraph.content: If applicable, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will not reduce the loan balance. If the new payment will result in negative amortization, a statement that the new payment will not be allocated to pay loan principal and will pay only part of the loan interest, thereby adding to the balance of the loan. If the new payment will result in negative amortization as a result of the interest rate adjustment, the statement shall set forth the payment required to amortize fully the remaining balance at the new interest rate over the remainder of the loan term.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-viii
paragraph.content: The circumstances under which any prepayment penalty, as defined in § 1026.32(b)(6)(i), may be imposed, such as when paying the loan in full or selling or refinancing the principal dwelling; the time period during which such a penalty may be imposed; and a statement that the consumer may contact the servicer for additional information, including the maximum amount of the penalty.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-ix
paragraph.content: The telephone number of the creditor, assignee, or servicer for consumers to call if they anticipate not being able to make their new payments.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x
paragraph.content: The following alternatives to paying at the new rate that consumers may be able to pursue and a brief explanation of each alternative, expressed in simple and clear terms:

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-A
paragraph.content: Refinancing the loan with the current or another creditor or assignee;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-B
paragraph.content: Selling the property and using the proceeds to pay the loan in full;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-C
paragraph.content: Modifying the terms of the loan with the creditor, assignee, or servicer; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-x-D
paragraph.content: Arranging payment forbearance with the creditor, assignee, or servicer.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-2-xi
paragraph.content: The Web site to access either the Bureau list or the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, the HUD toll-free telephone number to access the HUD list of homeownership counselors and counseling organizations, and the Bureau Web site to access contact information for State housing finance authorities (as defined in § 1301 of the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989).

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3
paragraph.title: Format.
paragraph.content: Format.

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-i
paragraph.content: Except for the disclosures required by paragraph (d)(2)(i) of this section, the disclosures required by this paragraph (d) shall be provided in the form of a table and in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, forms H-4(D)(3) and (4) in appendix H to this part;

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-ii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph (d)(2)(i) of this section shall appear outside of and above the table required in paragraph (d)(3)(i) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-20-d-3-iii
paragraph.content: The disclosures required by paragraph (d)(2)(iii) of this section shall be in the form of a table located within the table described in paragraph (d)(3)(i) of this section. These disclosures shall appear in the same order as, and with headings and format substantially similar to, the table inside the larger table in forms H-4(D)(3) and (4) in appendix H to this part.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i
paragraph.content: A covered transaction is not a qualified mortgage unless the transaction's total points and fees, as defined in § 1026.32(b)(1), do not exceed:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-A
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $100,000 (indexed for inflation): 3 percent of the total loan amount;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-B
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $60,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $100,000 (indexed for inflation): $3,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-C
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $20,000 (indexed for inflation) but less than $60,000 (indexed for inflation): 5 percent of the total loan amount;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-D
paragraph.content: For a loan amount greater than or equal to $12,500 (indexed for inflation) but less than $20,000 (indexed for inflation): $1,000 (indexed for inflation);

paragraph.label: 1026-43-e-3-i-E
paragraph.content: For a loan amount less than $12,500 (indexed for inflation): 8 percent of the total loan amount.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1
paragraph.title: Exemption.
paragraph.content: Exemption. Notwithstanding paragraph (e)(2) of this section, a qualified mortgage may provide for a balloon payment, provided:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs (e)(2)(i)(A), (e)(2)(ii), (e)(2)(iii), and (e)(2)(v) of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix Q;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-ii
paragraph.content: The creditor determines at or before consummation that the consumer can make all of the scheduled payments under the terms of the legal obligation, as described in paragraph (f)(1)(iv) of this section, together with the consumer's monthly payments for all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment, from the consumer's current or reasonably expected income or assets other than the dwelling that secures the loan;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iii
paragraph.content: The creditor considers at or before consummation the consumer's monthly debt-to-income ratio or residual income and verifies the debt obligations and income used to determine that ratio in accordance with paragraph (c)(7) of this section, except that the calculation of the payment on the covered transaction for purposes of determining the consumer's total monthly debt obligations in (c)(7)(i)(A) shall be determined in accordance with paragraph (f)(iv)(A) of this section, together with the consumer's monthly payments for all mortgage-related obligations and excluding the balloon payment;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv
paragraph.content: The legal obligation provides for:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-A
paragraph.content: Scheduled payments that are substantially equal, calculated using an amortization period that does not exceed 30 years;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-B
paragraph.content: An interest rate that does not increase over the term of the loan; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-iv-C
paragraph.content: A loan term of five years or longer.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-v
paragraph.content: The loan is not subject, at consummation, to a commitment to be acquired by another person, other than a person that satisfies the requirements of paragraph (f)(1)(vi) of this section; and

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-vi
paragraph.content: The creditor satisfies the requirements stated in § 1026.35(b)(2)(iii)(A), (B), and (C).

paragraph.label: 1026-25-a
paragraph.title: General rule.
paragraph.content: General rule. A creditor shall retain evidence of compliance with this regulation, other than advertising requirements under §§ 1026.16 and 1026.24 and certain requirements for mortgage loans under paragraph (c) of this section, for two years after the date disclosures are required to be made or action is required to be taken. The administrative agencies responsible for enforcing the regulation may require a creditor under their jurisdictions to retain records for a longer period if necessary to carry out their enforcement responsibilities under section 108 of the Act.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-b
paragraph.title: Inspection of records.
paragraph.content: Inspection of records. A creditor shall permit the agency responsible for enforcing this part with respect to that creditor to inspect its relevant records for compliance.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c
paragraph.content: Records related to certain requirements for mortgage loans.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-1
paragraph.content: [Reserved]

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2
paragraph.title: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation.
paragraph.content: Records related to requirements for loan originator compensation. Notwithstanding paragraph (a) of this section, for transactions subject to § 1026.36:

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-i
paragraph.content: A creditor shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all compensation it pays to a loan originator, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1), and the compensation agreement that governs those payments for three years after the date of payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-2-ii
paragraph.content: A loan originator organization, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1)(iii), shall maintain records sufficient to evidence all compensation it receives from a creditor, a consumer, or another person; all compensation it pays to any individual loan originator, as defined in § 1026.36(a)(1)(ii); and the compensation agreement that governs each such receipt or payment, for three years after the date of each such receipt or payment.

paragraph.label: 1026-25-c-3
paragraph.title: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling.
paragraph.content: Records related to minimum standards for transactions secured by a dwelling. Notwithstanding paragraph (a) of this section, a creditor shall retain evidence of compliance with § 1026.43 of this regulation for three years after consummation of a transaction covered by that section.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i
paragraph.title: Non-standard mortgage.
paragraph.content: Non-standard mortgage. The term non-standard mortgage means a covered transaction that is:

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-A
paragraph.content: An adjustable-rate mortgage, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(i), with an introductory fixed interest rate for a period of one year or longer;

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-B
paragraph.content: An interest-only loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(iv); or

paragraph.label: 1026-43-d-1-i-C
paragraph.content: A negative amortization loan, as defined in § 1026.18(s)(7)(v).

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2
paragraph.title: Explanation of amount due.
paragraph.content: Explanation of amount due. The following items, grouped together in close proximity to each other and located on the first page of the statement:

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-i
paragraph.content: The monthly payment amount, including a breakdown showing how much, if any, will be applied to principal, interest, and escrow and, if a mortgage loan has multiple payment options, a breakdown of each of the payment options along with information on whether the principal balance will increase, decrease, or stay the same for each option listed;

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-ii
paragraph.content: The total sum of any fees or charges imposed since the last statement; and

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-2-iii
paragraph.content: Any payment amount past due.

paragraph.label: 1026-43-b-10
paragraph.content: Prepayment penalty has the same meaning as in § 1026.32(b)(6).

paragraph.label: 1026-43-f-1-i
paragraph.content: The loan satisfies the requirements for a qualified mortgage in paragraphs (e)(2)(i)(A), (e)(2)(ii), (e)(2)(iii), and (e)(2)(v) of this section, but without regard to the standards in appendix Q;

paragraph.label: 1026-35-b-2-iv-B
paragraph.content: A county is “underserved” during a calendar year if, according to Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) data for the preceding calendar year, no more than two creditors extended covered transactions, as defined in § 1026.43(b)(1), secured by a first lien, five or more times in the county. A creditor may rely as a safe harbor on the list of counties published by the Bureau to determine whether a county qualifies as “underserved” for a particular calendar year.

paragraph.label: 1026-41-d-8
paragraph.title: Delinquency information.
paragraph.content: Delinquency information.
